name: Hilton Garden Inn Bakersfield

reviews.text: Like most Hilton Garden Inns, this one has nice clean rooms with microwave, refrigerator, and very comfortable beds. The service by all hotel staff has been very good and friendly. The breakfast was great. And unlike many Hilton Garden Inns, the restaurant in this one is open for dinner. I had room service twice and it was great both times! Salmon one night, and shrimp scampi the next. Both for under $25 including delivery charges, tip, etc. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Bakersfield Hotel!

reviews.text: Nice place to stay just off 99 with friendly staff.
reviews.title: Comfortable place for stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of nearby restaurants, Costco to fill up gas, heated pool
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!
excellent hotel
reviews.text: Good breakfast brunch at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've had to pass through Bakersfield three times in the past few months, and each time I've stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn. The staff is always very friendly and knowledgeable, the rooms are clean and quiet, and the beds are quite comfortable.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: We stay here each year as we travel up to Yosemite. This hotel suits us perfectly. The front desk staff is always so friendly and helpful. The location is so convenient, right off the freeway with many resturants within a couple of miles for dinner. The morning breakfast is a great way to start the day before we head up the highway. They will see us again!
reviews.title: Great customer service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great at a Bargain Price. Fabulous Staff and a fantastic Breakfast Buffet.
reviews.title: quiet and Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like Basque Food, Benjis is .3 miles away.
reviews.title: Fine, but nothing special--and the Doubletree is nicer

reviews.text: We look forward to our stay here in 2010.
reviews.title: Super Value

reviews.text: Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great Staff nice rooms

likes.liked: — Large Rooms Great Breakfast Comfy Beds

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night in June with no problems. Rooms were new and clean, and the staff was very helpful with restaurant recommendations (ate dinner at Mamma Tosca's which was excellent).
reviews.title: Nice and Convenient
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet in the morning is not complimentary, but was inexpensive ($10 for adults).
Free internet access a plus.
reviews.title: Convenient location when heading to the national parks

reviews.text: Overall, would stay here again if in the area.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms were a great size

reviews.text: Nice hotel for a 1-2 night stay.. Great AAA rate. Close to restaurant's, shopping. It was quiet, clean, had microwave and small fridge in room. Bathroom was clean and roomy. Nice pool - lots of kids though. Staff was friendly and nice. Would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Everything was fine, nothing overly extraordinary but nothing bad either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hadn't intended to stay here but Tioga Pass closing kind of changed our plans. We just walked into the hotel without a reservation but that was no problem. Price was pretty reasonable I thought particularly for such a nice hotel. We didn't venture out of the hotel so can't say anything about the surrounding area but it had very easy access to the Interstate which was exactly what we needed. I used the laundry downstairs and also the business centre to check email and had no problems with either. The only criticism I have is that the restuarant wasn't great. The waiter had suggested that I didn't have the pizza as I would only complain which I thought was good however then the rest of the food was nothing to write home about. It is only a very small restaurant though and there were other choices around if we could have been bothered to leave the hotel. All in all a pretty good unexpected stay.
reviews.title: Perfect for a stopover

reviews.text: Spent one night last weekend with our family and thought the experience was very good. The free wireless internet was available immediately in the room with no password required & they offered a complimentary printing service in the business center near the main lobby. Good shower heads & water pressure in the shower. We booked on the Hilton website and chose the "Life's Great Getaways" package which included full cooked breakfast for our family of four (we had 2 rooms). Breakfast was very good, extensive buffet plus eggs and waffles, french toast etc. cooked to order. (Our sometimes hard to please teenage girls were happy!) Will stay there again if we ever have to return to Bakersfield. Only negatives: 1) There is no view to speak of....dismal industrial view from our room, but we weren't there to gaze out the window. 2) We asked for non-smoking room and got 2 rooms near a smoking zone. The hallways definitely smelled of smoke, but fortunately our rooms were smoke free. Entire family thought the beds were extrememly comfortable. We needed two rooms, so they were able to give us two adjoing room that had communal access. Overall, we thought it was a very good value for the price and experience and doubt there is a better choice in Bakersfield.
reviews.title: Great Value for all the little extras

likes.disliked: — Borders industrial area, non smoking room accessed by smoky hallway

reviews.text: First the location. 2 minutes West off the 99, on highway 58 ( Rosedale highway). You'll know that already if you've booked - however take the first left of the highway ( Camino Del Rio) which leads around to the right and Marriot drive and the Hilton.
reviews.title: Only the price prevents 5 stars

likes.disliked: — No real character - a little expensive

reviews.text: Secondly you don't always get a real feel for other hotels locations when your looking on line. The Red lion, Doubletree, Comfort Suites, Courtyard by Marriot, the Hilton and another being built are all located on this stretch of road in very close proximity.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay

likes.liked: — It's a Hilton, with a name to uphold

reviews.text: As for the Hilton. Second to last hotel on the road. The last of which was being built. No nice view to the front or rear (fairly barren and industrial). Fairly non descript looking hotel too (no real character), though lots of parking to the front and rear. The hotel (garden inn) itself is immaculately presented. Spotless, airy reception with seating to the left and a bar and restaurant area to the right. Excellant helpful staff. The pool is tiny and would suit kids having a splash only - you definately can't do laps! There is a small excercise room consisting of a treadmill, bike and eliptical runner - thats it. Free internet with printing is available and worked well. 3 (i think) terminals in a room next to reception. Theres pc access in the rooms though didn't use it. The bar is just a small counter in the corner ( 4 stools?) and is just somewhere to obtain a drink. Extra seating is right behind in the restaurant seating. Didn't see anybody eating in the evening though breakfast looked ok on the way out the door.
reviews.title: Clean hotel, disappointing food; amenities

description: The Hilton Garden Inn Bakersfield hotel is only minutes from downtown Bakersfield, California and the Bakersfield Airport, near the intersection of California Highway 99 and Rosedale Highway. Buck Owens Crystal Palace, golf courses, tennis, jogging and hiking trails are nearby.
